critique: This executive order establishes Federal Regional Councils and an Under Secretaries Group for Regional Operations to coordinate Federal program assistance to State and local governments. It aims to improve the delivery of Federal programs and resolve conflicts between Federal agencies. There is no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideological tilt. The order does not directly address immigration. It could be argued that it expands executive power by centralizing coordination within the executive branch, but it also aims to improve efficiency and cooperation with state and local governments. It strengthens federal control by centralizing program coordination. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It involves government in economic matters by coordinating federal program grants and operations. It does not directly address social inclusion.
